passages.text:
You are in your own room. The carpet is a navy blue and in front of you is a CRT television with an "Uber Tinendo System" game console plugged in. You're currently play a game called "Interactive Fiction".

[[Look around the room->The room]]
[[Focus on the game->Interactive Fiction]]
[[Go to sleep->Sleep]]
passages.name: Your Room

passages.text:
You look around the room. This is the room you grew up in. You had your crib, first bed, and now a lofted bed in this room. It holds many memories, and as you look at the pictures and posters around the room, it reminds you of your childhood.

[[Better times...->Your Room]]
passages.name: The room

passages.text:
You look at the screen, the game is on the main menu and has three menus:

[[Play->Play]]
[[Options->Options]]
[[Credits->Credits]]
passages.name: Interactive Fiction

passages.text:
You decide to go to sleep, it's not even that late, you just aren't feeling like doing much today.

[[Wake up the next morning->Your Room]]
passages.name: Sleep

passages.text:
You start playing through the game.
It's a sort of choose-your-own adventure style "story".
You make decisions for characters and influence the direction the story goes.

[[This game isn't that bad->Play2]]
passages.name: Play

passages.text:
An options page pops up.

[[Back to main menu->Interactive Fiction]] 
[[Adjust brightness->Brightness]]
[[Adjust volume->Volume]]
passages.name: Options

passages.text:
The credits slowly roll by.
You try to skip them by pressing the Start button, but nothing happens.
You regret clicking on this menu.

[[Finally->Interactive Fiction]]
passages.name: Credits

passages.text:
You begin to turn the brightness up and accidentally crank it up to max.
It hurts your eyes and you quickly readjust it back down.
You're ready to play

[[Play->Play]]
passages.name: Brightness

passages.text:
You crank up the volume and settle in, ready to play.

[[Play->Play]]
passages.name: Volume

passages.text:
After playing through it for a while, you appreciate how your choices actually affect things that happen later in the game. Your choices are actually meaningful.

[[Good game->Good game]]
passages.name: Play2

passages.text:
After finishing the game a few days later, you hop online and give it a good rating and a positive review.

The end.
passages.name: Good game
